metadata.title: CVE-2021-47121 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: net:caif: fix memory leak in cfusbl_device_notify In case of caif_enroll_dev()fail, allocated link_support won't be assigned to the correspondingstructure. So simply free allocated pointer in case of error.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47121` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-154.161
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-154.161
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-154.161
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-154.161
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-154.161
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic - 5.4.0-81.91~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-81.91~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-152-lowlatency - 5.4.0-81.91~18.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-154.161').
